p: Dorsal laminectomy at T9‚ÄêT10 with partial corpectomy was performed two months later and bone was submitted for histopathological evaluation which revealed a proliferative lesion affecting spongy osseous tissue with no evidence of malignant neoplasia. Three months after surgery the dog was ambulatory. The main difference with the Ivory vertebra sign reported in humans in this case was the overgrowth of the bone causing spinal cord compression.
